intro: Diplotaxis leucanthemifolia, commonly known as the white-flowered dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant produces small, white flowers that are similar in appearance to those of the common dandelion. Its leaves are typically hairy and have a somewhat succulent texture. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
